summary:
The Security Council,
 
Resolution 1422 (2002) adopted on 12 July 2002.

Noting the International Criminal Court (ICC) Statute's entry into force on 1 July 2002, and emphasizing the importance of UN operations to international peace and security.

Noting not all states are parties to the Rome Statute; States Parties accept ICC jurisdiction under the principle of complementarity.

Determining UN operations aim to maintain or restore international peace and security.

Acting under Chapter VII of the UN Charter,

1. Requests the ICC not to commence or proceed with investigations or prosecutions for 12 months, starting 1 July 2002, of current or former officials or personnel from a non-State Party to the Rome Statute, involved in UN operations, unless the Security Council decides otherwise, consistent with Article 16 of the Rome Statute.

2. Expresses intention to renew this request annually for 12-month periods as necessary.

3. Decides Member States shall take no action inconsistent with paragraph 1 and their international obligations.

4. Decides to remain seized of the matter.
